channel.title: Packaging
channel.description:
Well, after packaging my server and fixing most of the errors, I'm left with these:
[code].\Soul\SoulSociety\server.java:25: PlayerHandler() is not public in Soul.SoulSociety.Player.PlayerHandler; cannot be accessed f rom outside package playerHandler = new PlayerHandler(); ^ .\Soul\SoulSociety\World\client.java:86: destruct() is not public in Soul.SoulSociety.Player.Player; cannot be accessed from ou tside package super.destruct(); ^ Note: .\Soul\SoulSociety\Utility\stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Building done Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Really bugging me. Seems like something obvious, though....
Anyone know?

item.title: Packaging
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Well, after packaging my server and fixing most of the errors, I’m left with these:

.\Soul\SoulSociety\server.java:25: PlayerHandler() is not public in Soul.SoulSociety.Player.PlayerHandler; cannot be accessed f rom outside package playerHandler = new PlayerHandler(); ^ .\Soul\SoulSociety\World\client.java:86: destruct() is not public in Soul.SoulSociety.Player.Player; cannot be accessed from ou tside package super.destruct(); ^ Note: .\Soul\SoulSociety\Utility\stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Building done Press any key to continue . . .

Really bugging me. Seems like something obvious, though…

Anyone know?
